titleStmt.title: Despatch from J. Milton Turner to John L. Cadwalader, May 25, 1876

bibl.title: Despatch from J. Milton Turner to John L. Cadwalader
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States, at Monrovia, Republic of Liberia.

J. Milton Turner
To the Department of State Washington
Report for the Quarter ended 30th June 1877.

No. 1. Letters Received
" 2. Do Sent
" 3. Statement of Salary Account
Account
No. 4. Abstract of Contingent Expenses
" 5. Voucher for Postage for quarter ended 30 Mar.
" 6. Voucher for Postage for quarter ended 30 June.
" 7. Voucher for Loss by Exchange for quarter ended 30 Mar.
" 8. Arrivals and Departures of American Vessels.
" 9. Invoice Book.

Consulate General fo the United States, Monrovia Liberia
30 June 1877.
I have the honor to transmit herewith my consular report for the quarter ending this day.

The difficulty which, on account of the scarcity of money at Monrovia, attends the exchange of Bills or Drafts of any considerable amount, has made
Honorable Frederick W. Seward
Assistant Secty of State
Washington
made it necessary for me to draw, for my salary for the month of June, two drafts instead of one, as instructed heretofore. I regress this circumstance and will endeavor, hereafter to obey the instruction referred to ask near as it may be possible.

I have to be, Sir, with expressions of high esteem
Your obedient Servant,
J. Milton Turner
